sources.name: World Health Organization, Global Health Observatory data repository.
sources.description:
Data published by World Health Organization. Global Health Observatory data repository
Data publisher's source Various. See additional information for the nature of the data sources for each variable.
Link http://apps.who.int/gho/data/node.home
Retrieved 05/05/2017

Additional information:

BCG immunization coverage:

Preferred data sources: Household surveys.

More information available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=2442

Estimated number of deaths due to tuberculosis, excluding HIV:

Preferred data sources: Civil registration with complete coverage and medical certification of cause of death.

Other possible data sources: Sample or sentinel registration systems, Special studies, and Specific population surveys

More information on methods of measurement and estimation is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=1425

Estimated deaths due to tuberculosis, excluding HIV (per 100 000 population)

Preferred data sources: Civil registration with complete coverage and medical certification of cause of death.

Other possible data sources: Sample or sentinel registration systems, Special studies, and Specific population surveys

More information on methods of measurement and estimation is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=17

DPT3 Immunization coverage:

Preferred data sources: Facility reporting system, and Household surveys.

More information on methods of measurement and estimation is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=88

Reported cases of diphtheria:

Confirmed diphtheria cases, including those confirmed clinically, epidemiologically, or by laboratory investigation. Cases that have been discarded following laboratory investigation should not be included.

Preferred data sources: Surveillance systems.

More information on methods of measurement and estimation is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=43

Reported cases of total tetanus:

Preferred data sources: Surveillance systems.

More information is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=48

Reported cases of pertussis:

Confirmed pertussis cases, including those confirmed clinically, epidemiologically, or by laboratory investigation. Cases that have been discarded following laboratory investigation should not be included.

Preferred data sources: Surveillance systems.

More information is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=45

Polio immunization coverage:

Preferred data sources: Facility reporting system, and Household surveys.

More information on methods of measurement and estimation is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=2443

Reported cases of poliomyelitis

Reported cases of laboratory-confirmed polio cases. A polio case is confirmed if wild poliovirus is isolated from stool specimens collected from an Acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) case.

Preferred data sources: Surveillance systems.

More information is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=51

Measles immunization coverage:

For countries recommending the first dose of measles vaccine in children over 12 months of age, the indicator is calculated as the proportion of children less than 12-23 months of age receiving one dose of measles-containing vaccine.

Preferred data sources: Facility reporting system, and Household surveys.

More information on methods of measurement and estimation is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=2

Reported cases of measles:

Confirmed measles cases, including those confirmed clinically, epidemiologically, or by laboratory investigation. Cases that have been discarded following laboratory investigation should not be included.

Preferred data sources: Surveillance systems.

More information is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=60

Hepatitis B immunization coverage:

Preferred data sources: Facility reporting system, and Household surveys.

More information on methods of measurement and estimation is available at the link: http://apps.who.int/gho/indicatorregistry/App_Main/view_indicator.aspx?iid=95

variables.name: Reported cases of diphtheria
variables.description: Number of reported cases of diphtheria.

variables.name: Estimated number of deaths due to tuberculosis, excluding HIV
variables.description: The estimated number of deaths attributable to tuberculosis (TB) in a given year.

variables.name: Estimated deaths due to tuberculosis, excluding HIV (per 100 000 population)
variables.description: Estimated deaths due to tuberculosis (TB), excluding HIV (per 100 000 population).

variables.name: BCG immunization coverage
variables.description: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received one dose of bacille Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine in a given year.

variables.name: DTP3 Immunization coverage
variables.description: Diphtheria tetanus toxoid and pertussis (DTP3) immunization coverage among 1-year-olds (%). The percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of the combined diphtheria, tetanus toxoid and pertussis vaccine in a given year.

variables.name: Reported cases of pertussis
variables.description: Number of reported cases of pertussis.

variables.name: Reported cases of total tetanus
variables.description: Number of confirmed total tetanus cases.

variables.name: Polio immunization coverage
variables.description: Polio (Pol3) immunization coverage among 1-year-olds (%). The percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of polio vaccine in a given year.

variables.name: Reported cases of poliomyelitis
variables.description: Number of reported cases of poliomyelitis.

variables.name: Measles immunization coverage
variables.description: The percentage of children under one year of age who have received at least one dose of measles-containing vaccine in a given year.

variables.name: Reported cases of measles
variables.description: Number of reported cases of measles.

variables.name: Hepatitis B immunization coverage
variables.description: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of hepatitis B vaccine in a given year.
